result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Scott Cotterman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a payment plan worked out with agent as a condition of community supervision.

Pay all court obligations and supervision fees.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a payment plan worked out with agent as a condition of community supervision.

Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
Obtain GED or HSED.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.
No contact with W.B., T.B. or L.H. or their immediate families or residences.

Assessments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept. of Corrections.
